overview:
## Return Value

JSON data for `obj`, or `nil` if an internal error occurs. The resulting data is encoded in UTF-8.

## Discussion

If `obj` can’t produce valid JSON, [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/JSONSerialization] throws an exception. This exception occurs prior to parsing and represents a programming error, not an internal error. Before calling this method, you should check whether the input can produce valid JSON by using [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/JSONSerialization/isValidJSONObject(_:)].

Setting the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/JSONSerialization/WritingOptions/prettyPrinted] option generates JSON with white space designed to make the output more readable. If this option isn’t set, [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/JSONSerialization] generates the most compact possible JSON.

# data(withJSONObject:options:)

**Type Method**

Returns JSON data from a Foundation object.

## Declaration

```swift
class func data(withJSONObject obj: Any, options opt: JSONSerialization.WritingOptions = []) throws -> Data
```

## Parameters

- **obj**: The object from which to generate JSON data. Must not be `nil`.
- **opt**: Options for creating the JSON data.

See [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/JSONSerialization/WritingOptions] for possible values.

## Return Value

JSON data for `obj`, or `nil` if an internal error occurs. The resulting data is encoded in UTF-8.

## Discussion

If `obj` can’t produce valid JSON, [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/JSONSerialization] throws an exception. This exception occurs prior to parsing and represents a programming error, not an internal error. Before calling this method, you should check whether the input can produce valid JSON by using [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/JSONSerialization/isValidJSONObject(_:)].

Setting the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/JSONSerialization/WritingOptions/prettyPrinted] option generates JSON with white space designed to make the output more readable. If this option isn’t set, [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/JSONSerialization] generates the most compact possible JSON.



## Creating JSON Data

- **writeJSONObject(_:to:options:error:)**: Writes a given JSON object to a stream.
- **JSONSerialization.WritingOptions**: Options for writing JSON data.
- **isValidJSONObject(_:)**: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the serializer can convert a given object to JSON data.
